Function Documentation

void print_block ( void *  item,
uint32_t  index,
uint16_t  size,
uint16_t  width 
)

Prints a block of hex in a pretty way.

Prints a block of hex out along with the associated address and ASCII characters. Any line that needs padding has byte values represented by "--"

Relies on avr-libc and proper binding of stdout

Parameters:
item a pointer to the data to print
index an address index to print with the data
size the number of bytes to print
width the number of bytes to print on a single line

void print_hex ( void *  item,
uint16_t  size 
)

Prints a bunch of hex.

Prints each byte out in capital hex, zero padded, and separated by spaces. For large amounts of data, see print_block().

Relies on avr-libc and proper binding of stdout

Parameters:
item a pointer to the data to print
size the number of bytes to print
